Message:
After the two witches left,
Gran and I spent many
peaceful days with one another.

I grew taller,
and Gran grew more wrinkles,
as we both aged side by side...

One night, Gran handed
something to me.

In the palm of her hand
was a brooch with
an emblem of a bluebird on it.

“I couldn’t face my own grief,
and forced even you to endure
your pain for my sake.”

“I failed to teach the baby bird
in my care to fly, chaining you
forever to the nest.
Be free now, my little bird.”

The next morning,
Gran had passed away.

My tears won’t come out...
But, when my parents died,
I could never stop crying...

Like the lid of a jam jar
crusted tightly shut,
something inside me is stuck.
But, I don’t know what
that something is...

Am I...not sad...?
Have I been resenting
Gran this whole time...?
How can I be this heartless...?!
